intro: Draba chodatii, commonly known as the Chodat's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the western United States and parts of northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It has a compact growth form with basal leaves and is often found in mountainous regions. Draba chodatii is adapted to cold climates and is a perennial species that blooms in early spring.
